settings.text: Finally, spring is upon us. As the days grow a little longer and the sun starts to make an appearance a little more often, now is the time to energise your wardrobe. Spring can still be unpredictable, so it’s good to rely on an edit of strong basics to see you through the season with style and ease.

settings.grid-content:
Everywhere Knitwear

The best knitwear will transition from day to night seamlessly, and you simply cannot go wrong with a soft jumper, or a classic button-down cardigan. Team yours with jeans or tailored trousers, or settle in for the evening by layering over your favourite loungewear. Chunky cotton knits are perfect for those days when there’s glorious sunshine but a chill in the air.

Cropped Trousers

Now that the weather is starting to warm up, it’s time to think about leaving your winter cocoon. We’re not saying that loungewear doesn’t have its place in your rotation - see below - however, a pair of trousers is perfect for when you want to smarten your look a little. Opt for one of this season’s super flattering cropped silhouettes - they hit just above the ankle and look great with everything from trainers to sandals. Choose a colour-block pair to brighten your day.

Everywhere Knitwear

We’re big believers in loungewear, for its balance of comfort and style. Inevitably, there will still be plenty of cooler days and cosy nights spent at home, and wearing a pair of cashmere track pants on the sofa is our chosen way to unwind. Superlatively soft, you’ll be reaching for these whatever the time of year.

A Spring Dress

The days of bundling up from head-to-toe are not long behind us, but it might not be long before you dare to step out in a dress. Layer a cashmere jumper or cardigan over floaty styles, and pair with ankle boots or a low heel - depending on the weather, of course. Florals for spring may be nothing groundbreaking, but they’re a perennial favourite for a reason. Choose between ditsy and supersize prints to raise your spirits.

Plain White Tee

If your white T-shirt collection isn’t looking quite as bright as you thought, now is the time to refresh it. A crisp white T-shirt makes a vital addition to your spring rotation, as it will go with practically anything. Team it with everything from jeans and a jumper, to trousers and a tailored blazer.

The Easy Trainer

It’s nearly time to tuck the boots back into your wardrobe for a few months, but you might not quite be ready for sandals just yet. A pair of trainers is our between-seasons footwear of choice. Opt for classic Chuck Taylors - pair them with your cropped trousers for a relaxed week-to-weekend aesthetic.

Slip-on Loafers

The loafer has made its way into many women’s wardrobes thanks to its easy-chic appeal. If you’re keen on a flat shoe that is a little more polished than sneakers, the loafer will do perfectly. From refined backless styles to embellished iterations, there’s a loafer out there for everyone. Wear yours with jeans to transition from office to home effortlessly.

Everyday Handbag

Handbag silhouettes are on the soft and slouchy side this season. You’ll want to opt for something roomy for spring; allowing for extra space to store all your essentials, especially if the weather warms up enough for you to shed a layer. Neutral tan or camel shades will complement this season’s feel-good palette beautifully.
